content: Max Müller, thank you for answering. You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a man named Peter Schmidt.
name: Max Müller

content: Peter Schmidt, interesting name. What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of our conversation was the rental price of an apartment in München.
name: Max Müller

content: Rental price of an apartment in München, I see. Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: I'm sorry to hear that. If you don't mind me asking, what was the sticking point in the negotiation?
name: Evaluator

content: The sticking point was the rental price. I was willing to pay 625 Euros per month, but Peter Schmidt was not willing to accept less than 650 Euros.
name: Max Müller

content: Understood. It seems like you had a clear difference in what you were willing to pay and what Peter Schmidt was asking for. How would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner on a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikely and 10 being very likely? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: An 8 out of 10, that's quite high. It seems like you found the negotiation partner to be quite likeable despite not reaching an agreement on the price. At any point during the negotiation, did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: Good to hear that you did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation. If you had to negotiate again with the same person, would you approach the conversation differently?
name: Evaluator
